title: Mikulicz Syndrome: Clinical Overview and Characteristics
short_description: Clinical document describing Mikulicz syndrome, a chronic condition involving abnormal enlargement of head and neck glands associated with underlying systemic disorders.
long_description: This clinical document provides a comprehensive overview of Mikulicz syndrome, a chronic benign condition characterized by abnormal enlargement of various glands in the head and neck region, including parotid, lacrimal, and salivary glands. The document details the syndrome's association with underlying disorders such as tuberculosis, leukemia, syphilis, Hodgkin's disease, lymphosarcoma, Sjögren syndrome, and lupus. It describes key clinical manifestations including xerostomia (extreme mouth dryness), enlarged tear and salivary glands, and the increased risk of lymphoma development. The document also notes the similarity between Mikulicz syndrome and Sjögren syndrome symptoms, suggesting potential diagnostic overlap.
